txt.en:
'My baby!'

The distraught woman continues crying.

'Jackals killed my baby!'

She looks up at you.

'You. You will help me, yes? Jackals roam these lands unchecked, free to go wherever they wish and to eat whoever they want.'

You ask her how you can help. Her wet, bloodshot eyes lock onto yours.

'I want you to wipe them out. All of them.'

After you have recovered from your choking fit, you tell her you will not do that, but could cull some of the animals if they are too aggressive and numerous.

'I will take what I can get. You have offered me more than anyone else has. Thank you.'
Talk to Shalâra in Western Khanâg
You should defeat jackals in Khûd Zagin in an effort to prevent further tragedies, such as the one Shalâra has suffered.
Shalâra has told you that jackals killed her baby. Following a short discussion, you have offered to cull the jackal population to a more reasonable number.
'You have slain some of them? Thank you for avenging my baby. I know that it is what my precious Boots would have wanted. I am grateful.'
You have defeated jackals in Khûd Zagin in an effort to prevent further tragedies, such as the one Shalâra has suffered. You should return to Shalâra in Western Khanâg.
